titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Vishnu Divecha Collection
titlestmt.author: Christian Kelleher

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was encoded in EAD by Archon 3.21 from an SQL database source on December 12th, 2016.

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Vishnu Divecha Collection

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: The collection consists of Sanskrit and Gita scholar Vishnu K. Divecha's work as a translator, teacher, and student of the Bhagavad Gita and other Sanskrit and Hindi works, as well as a library of such works.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information:
bioghist.p: Vishnu Divecha is a graduate of the University of Houston, where he earned his Master of Science in Industrial Engineering (MSIE). He also earned his Master of Science in Civil Engineering (MSCE) degree from Kansas State University, and his undergraduate degree in Engineering from Sardar Patel University. Divecha studied Sanskrit and Gita in high school under the guidance of Vedantic teacher shri Manishanker Joshi of Una, Gujarat, India. He was awarded title of Acharya in 2003 for his outstanding service promoting Sanskrit and Gita knowledge.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, obtaining permission to publish from copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian. Reproduction decisions will be made by Special Collections staff on a case-by-case basis.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Information of acquisition method not available.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: Vishnu Divecha Collection. Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries. To cite a specific item from this collection, please consult the most recent edition of your style manual for the proper formatting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of Sanskrit and Gita scholar Vishnu K. Divecha's work as a translator, teacher, and student of the Bhagavad Gita and other Sanskrit and Hindi works, as well as a library of such works.
From: Scripture/Mahabharata; Section: Udyoga Parva (1 of 18); Chapters: 33 through 39; By: Vidur Mahatma Explanation: Sanskrit break-down, Hindi, and English by Vishnu Divecha. Typescript.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published works collected by Vishnu Divecha.

did.unittitle: Om Sri Ramacaritamanasa [or The Manasa lake brimming over with the exploits of Sri Rama] (With Hindi Text and English Translation). Gita Press, Gorakhpur, India.
Om Sri Paramatmane Namah Srimadbhagavadgita Tattvavivecani (English Commentary), Joyadayal Goyandaka. Gita Press, Gorakhpur, India.
Srimad Bhagavad Geeta. Sanskrit into Gujarati. Commentator Sri Nathuram Sharma Bilkha-Sau-Guj.
Sri Isopanisad, His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. Bhaktivedanta Book Trust, Los Angeles, 1993.
Tulasidasa's Shri Ramacharitamanasa (The Holy Lake of the Acts of Rama), edited and translated into Hindi and English by R. C. Prasad. Motilal Banarsidass Publishers, Dehli, 1990.
